newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - Coffee seen pulling back but still bullish.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - Coffee seen pulling back but still bullish.

text.p: JULY Close * Support * Resist * RSI14 * MA10 * MA30
LIFFE coffee futures are seen pulling back for a couple of days, before resuming their bull run with a vengeance, analysts said.
July robustas were called to open $10 down after closing near their session low on Thursday.
Trevor Neil, senior technical analyst at Union Cal Futures, said London's attempt to rally on Thursday was weak as July tried to take out resistance but failed in low volume.
"Technically, that's a weak sign, and I expect follow-through on the downside this morning," he said.
Neil said July's reaction near support between $2,020 and $2,010 would be important. "If it fails there, I would target a gap toward $1,860," he said.
"The trend is still strongly up." Despite the short-term losses expected, there was no sign that a major top has been put in.
If a sell-off materialised in the near term, July would be able to work off some of its extremely overbought relative strength index (RSI) position, analysts added.

Neil expected weakness to only last through about Wednesday before coffee surged again. He said he would view any fall as a temporary, intermediate profit-taking setback so long as Tuesday's opening was at $2,010 or higher.
London's markets are closed on Monday for a public holiday.

When coffee resumed its bull run, July should touch $2,300. "That is a modest estimate just based on momentum. I think it can touch that quite easily and quickly. The market is extremely bullish," Neil said.
